item.title: Francesco Arena - Cubic Metre of Seawater as a Diagonal | Sprovieri
item.description: Two shows from Italian artists caught my eye this week. First, this exhibition from Franceso Arena at one of the west endâ€™s least accessible galleries, up a flight of stairs behind Regent Street. Arena makes vaguely arte povera-aligned works, using natural and found materials. The centrepiece of this show is rather grandiose: exactly as the title suggests, seawater is contained in a metal trough, 13 metres long, oriented diagonally across the largest gallery.
